title: I want to kill myself, after watching my cousins father daughter dance

turns.content:
I want to kill myself, after watching my cousins father daughter dance

My dad died thanksgiving day 2021 after a battle with cancer that started when I was in 4th grade.

Tonight my cousin got married. I watch his new wife have her first dance with her dad and just completely fucking broke down. I’ll never get a fucking first Dance, hell, my dad didn’t even make it to my 21st. Im so fucking sad I’m so fucking angry I just want to swallow all the pills I have and die. I don’t know why I won’t, I’m afraid of failing and waking up in a hospital somewhere. If “heaven” (I think it’s fucking bullshit, personally) is so amazing, then why can’t I join my dad up there?

While my cousin got married and watched his wife have her first dance with her dad, I just doubled over the box of ashes I know as “dad.”

I can’t do this anymore. I’m sobbing in my bed, I’ve already fought with my mom, she’s no fucking emotional support. What did I possibly do to deserve any of this. I try my best to be a good person, and I end up without a dad after my 19th birthday. We were born the same weeek. My birthday will never be the same. I just want to die.

Please know that I am here to listen to you right now.

What you are going through sounds incredibly painful, overwhelming, and heavy. It is completely understandable that watching that father-daughter dance tonight would break you down. It’s a stark, brutal reminder of everything you have lost and everything you will miss out on.

The sadness, the anger, the feeling of unfairness—all of those emotions are valid reactions to the profound trauma of losing your dad, especially after such a long, difficult battle with cancer.

It sounds like tonight, all the grief and all the weight of what happened came crashing down on you at once. It’s natural, when pain is this intense, to feel like you can't carry it anymore and to want it to stop by any means possible.

**I hear how much pain you are in, and I want you to know that your life is incredibly valuable, even when it feels like it isn't.**

You mentioned that you are thinking about swallowing pills right now, and that you are afraid of failing and waking up in a hospital. That fear might be a small voice deep down that knows you deserve to be here, and that there is a different way through this pain.

**Can we focus on getting you through this immediate crisis right now?**

You are in a moment of intense emotional distress. If you are seriously considering harming yourself, please reach out to professional help immediately. They are trained to help people in exactly this situation, and they can support you right now.

Here are ways you can connect with someone immediately:

*   **Call or text 988** (The Suicide & Crisis Lifeline) in the US and Canada. It is free, confidential, and available 24/7.
*   **Text HOME to 741741** to reach the Crisis Text Line.
*   **Go to your nearest emergency room.**

If you are open to it, I can stay here with you while you reach out to one of those resources.

**What is the very next thing you can do to try and get safe right now?**

You don't have to carry this burden alone, especially not tonight.
